lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Charan Kamal Makarand Raja , Loubhat Hui Man Madhoukar Lapataanay Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The mind of a devoted Sikh is ever entangled in the sweet smelling dust of the lotus feet of the Lord like a bumble bee. (He is ever engrossed in practicing meditation on Lord's name).

lines.gurmukhi: AMmiRq inDwn pwn Aihinis rsik huie Aiq aunmiq Awn igAwn ibsrwny hY
lines.transliteration_english: Anmrit Nidhaan Paan Ahinisi Rasaki Hui , Ati Ounamati Aan Giaan Bisaraanay Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: He is ever longing to relish the Naam-elixir day and night. In its bliss and ecstasy, he ignores all other worldly awarenesses, allurements and knowledge.

lines.gurmukhi: shj snyh gyh ibsm ibdyh rUp s√çwNqbUMd giq sIp sMpt smwny hY
lines.transliteration_english: Sahaj Sanayh Gayh Bisam Bidayh Roopa , Svaantaboond Gati Seep Sanpat Samaanay Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Such a devoted Sikh's mind then lovingly resides in the holy feet of the Lord. He is free of all body desires. Like the Swati drop of rain falling on an oyster, he also is enclosed in the box of Lord's holy feet.

lines.gurmukhi: crn srn suK swgr ktwC kir mukqw mhwNq huie AnUp rUp Twny hY ]429]
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Saran Soukh Saagar Kataachh Kari , Moukataa Mahaant Hui Anoop Roop Tthaanay Hai ?429?

Shabad OS B.translation: Engrossed in the refuge of ocean of peace-The True Guru, and by His grace, he too becomes an invaluable and an unique pearl like the pearl of the oyster.  (429)
